title: Nanoscale Charge Redistribution under Electron and Photon Illumination: Insights from Off-axis Electron Holography
content: Nanoscale characterization of charge redistribution under photon illumination has significant impact in understanding the fundamentals related to functional properties of material in applications such as photocatalysis. Although nanoscale characterization of structure and composition via imaging or spectroscopy can be accomplished with contemporary high resolution microscopy based techniques, seeing charge redistribution inside the microscope is quite challenging. Off-axis electron holography has been used to characterize the electrostatic fields originating due to redistribution of charge under electron beam irradiation inside an electron microscope [2, 5, 6].
